author: rkeithhill
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

BTW this "extra" item is only generated on RedHat.  It doesn't happen on Ubuntu and it doesn't happen on Windows.  🤷‍♂️

## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
PS> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0-preview.6
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0-preview.6
OS                             Linux 3.10.0-229.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Jan 29 18:37:38 EST 2015
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS> git show -s --pretty=%d HEAD | fhx

   Label: String (System.String) <6D74A3C3>

          Offset Bytes                                           Ascii
                 00 01 02 03 04 05 06 07 08 09 0A 0B 0C 0D 0E 0F
          ------ ----------------------------------------------- -----
0000000000000000 20 28 48 45 41 44 2C 20 6F 72 69 67 69 6E 2F 64  (HEAD, origin/d
0000000000000010 65 76 65 6C 6F 70 29                            evelop)

PS> (git show -s --pretty=%d HEAD) -split ',' | % {"Item: '$_'"}
Item: ' (HEAD'
Item: ' origin/develop)'
Item: ''
```

## Expected behavior
Outputs:
```none
Item: ' (HEAD'
Item: ' origin/develop)'
```

## Actual behavior
Outputs:
```none
Item: ' (HEAD'
Item: ' origin/develop)'
Item: ''
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0-preview.6
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0-preview.6
OS                             Linux 3.10.0-229.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Jan 29 18:37:38 EST 2015
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: jborean93
comments.body:
Is it just `git` that is doing this or any command that you run. If it's just `git` then it sounds like something in the `git` package make by that distro and outside of PowerShell itself.

It would be helpful to do `git show -s --pretty=%d HEAD > /tmp/git.txt` outside of PowerShell then do a `Format-Hex /tmp/git.txt` inside PowerShell to get the actual bytes that `git` outputs on each distro.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
It seems to be related to this develop branch on RedHat.  Even bash outputs an extra newline:
```
   Label: /home/mctcbld/git.txt

          Offset Bytes                                           Ascii
                 00 01 02 03 04 05 06 07 08 09 0A 0B 0C 0D 0E 0F
          ------ ----------------------------------------------- -----
0000000000000000 20 28 48 45 41 44 2C 20 6F 72 69 67 69 6E 2F 64  (HEAD, origin/d
0000000000000010 65 76 65 6C 6F 70 29 0A 0A                      evelop)��
```
Other branches on RedHat don't behave this way.  OK, chalking this up to old version of Git (1.8.3.1) weirdness.

title: Split operator bug on RedHat 7.1 - generates extra item
